item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, September 13, 2024 at 3:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Data sleuths who spotted research misconduct cleared of defamation (219 points | 34 comments)
2. Notes on OpenAI's new o1 chain-of-thought models (121 points | 83 comments)
3. FDA Authorizes First Over-the-Counter Hearing Aid Software (64 points | 24 comments)
4. The Strange Case of the Rogue HP-12c Calculator (40 points | 8 comments)
5. Learning to Reason with LLMs (1454 points | 1107 comments)
6. F3 – Fight Flash Fraud (56 points | 17 comments)
7. Notepat • Aesthetic Computer (37 points | 7 comments)
8. Breaking Down OnlyFans' Economics (86 points | 53 comments)
9. Show HN: iFixit created a new USB-C, repairable soldering system (704 points | 336 comments)
10. Imbue (Formerly Generally Intelligent) (YC S17) Is Hiring Software Engineers ( | hide)
11. GAZEploit: Remote keystroke inference attack by gaze estimation in VR/MR devices (154 points | 84 comments)
12. Understanding Concurrency, Parallelism and JavaScript (5 points | 1 comment)
13. Defusedxml – defusing XML bombs and other exploits (67 points | 15 comments)
14. Kolmogorov-Arnold networks may make neural networks more understandable (223 points | 69 comments)
15. Random access string compression with FSST and Rust (43 points | 5 comments)
16. Why Haskell? (326 points | 417 comments)
17. If I could dissect a sauropod (112 points | 16 comments)
18. Advertising platform The Trade Desk is building its own smart TV OS (8 points | 4 comments)
19. Questions about LLMs in Group Chats (3 points | discuss)
20. Some pterosaurs would flap, others would soar (9 points | discuss)
21. Show HN: Galaxy Visualization (51 points | 11 comments)
22. Greenland landslide caused freak wave that shook Earth for nine days (26 points | 4 comments)
23. Linear, symmetric, self-selecting 14-bit molecular memristors (2023) (96 points | 54 comments)
24. Interview Learnings from Former CIA Intelligence Officer (9 points | 2 comments)
25. Qubit Transistors Reach Error Correction Benchmark (62 points | 18 comments)
26. Jax and Equinox: What are they and why should I bother? (49 points | 5 comments)
27. Peer Gynt quilt, Part 1 (2021) (63 points | 6 comments)
28. Show HN: Repogather – copy relevant files to clipboard for LLM coding workflows (53 points | 26 comments)
29. Ask HN: Should I open source my licensing server? (19 points | 17 comments)
30. We spent $20 to achieve RCE and accidentally became the admins of .mobi (1546 points | 346 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, September 13, 2024 at 3:15 AM UTC
